datafield.subfield: Florida Senator Claude Pepper's executive secretary during the 1930s and 40s.
Florida State University Digital Library, viewed November 12, 2015:
Claude Pepper Papers, Photographs, Series E: Other People (William and Katherine Speed standing by Fireplace; Abstract/Description: Claude Pepper's former executive secretary in Tallahassee, Florida)
Florida State University Digital Library, viewed November 12, 2015:
Claude Pepper Diary of 1941 page 88 (Mrs. Katie Speed) page 106 (Kathryn Speed)
Social Networks and Archives Context - SNAC, viewed November 12, 2015:

(Tallahassee Pecan Company - Biographical notes: ... On April 4, 1917, Katherine Hovermale was sworn in as Secretary of the [Tallahassee Pecan Company] ... In July 1925, there was a new certificate of incorporation. On November 10, 1936, a joint meeting of the stockholders and the board of directors was held, and Katherine Hovermale was recognized as owner of all capital stock and possessed the title to all assets of the company. Katherine Hovermale was later married to William Speed, and the Tallahassee Pecan Plantation was sold by Mr. and Mrs. Speed to Millard Caldwell of Tallahassee, who is the present owner)
